text: A majority of the incorporators or initial directors of a corporation that has not issued shares or has not commenced business may dissolve the corporation by delivering to the Mayor for filing articles of dissolution that set forth:
historical:
Legislative History of Laws

For history of Law 18-378, see notes under ยง 29-101.01.

DC CODE ยง 29-312.01

Current through December 11, 2012

sections.text: (A) That none of the corporation's shares has been issued; or
That the corporation has not commenced business;
That no debt of the corporation remains unpaid;
That the net assets of the corporation remaining after winding up have been distributed to the shareholders, if shares were issued; and
That a majority of the incorporators or initial directors authorized the dissolution.

heading.catch_text: Dissolution by incorporators or initial directors.
